context: The Finnish word 'sotilas' means 'soldier' in English. It is a common noun used to refer to military personnel or warriors serving in the armed forces. The word can be used in various contexts, such as referring to individual soldiers or groups of soldiers. In Finnish grammar, 'sotilas' follows normal noun declension patterns and can appear in different cases (e.g., nominative, genitive, partitive) depending on its grammatical function in a sentence.
